intro: Schismatoclada mandrarensis, commonly known as the Madagascar thornveld grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by insects for pollination. Schismatoclada mandrarensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, exhibiting drought tolerance through its succulent stems and reduced leaf surface. It plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
